meanings.definition: Present participle of the verb 'plain': expressing dissatisfaction or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The plaining customer left the store unhappy.
meanings.sent2: She had a plaining expression on her face after hearing the news.
meanings.sent3: The plaining child finally got his ice cream after a long wait.
meanings.sent4: The plaining wind outside matched her mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: His plaining tone made it clear he was not pleased.

meanings.definition: Adjective: characterized by expressing dissatisfaction or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The plaining cat meowed loudly at the closed door.
meanings.sent2: Her plaining voice could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The plaining dog refused to eat his dinner until he got a treat.
meanings.sent4: The plaining sound of the alarm clock woke her up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: His plaining attitude made it hard to have a pleasant conversation.

meanings.definition: Noun: the act of expressing dissatisfaction or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her constant plaining about the weather was getting tiresome.
meanings.sent2: The plaining of the students could be heard throughout the school.
meanings.sent3: The plaining at the meeting was so loud it was hard to focus.
meanings.sent4: The plaining in the office was a sign that changes were needed.
meanings.sent5: His plaining was like a broken record, repeating the same complaints.
